title: Moto9999
author: Moto9999
content: Am selling my btc account containing 0.3 btc for ethereum if it is a reputable member I go first

comments.author: stompix
comments.body: "account"?So that means you're selling the same account you're trying to get a loan on for, or basically a few worthless numbers in an account over at a scammy exchange.Quote from: Moto9999 on March 13, 2023, 08:58:30 PMThe collateral crypto is BTC worth $1500 the btc is on the platform https://dex-coinby.com/ please sign up send your addresse and I will transfer the collateral to you30 days old domain, the about us page is telling:https://dex-coinby.com/aboutQuoteOur company begins its history from June 2018, when it was developed.

comments.author: Stalker22
comments.body: Quote from: Moto9999 on March 14, 2023, 05:15:11 PMAm selling my btc account containing 0.3 btc for ethereum if it is a reputable member I go first I am not entirely sure what you are trying to sell based on your statement. Could you please provide more information about what you mean by "your BTC account"? Is it really an account at some kind of exchange, as stompix mentioned? Unless you can withdraw funds to another wallet address (non custodial), it is probably a scam.Please provide more details so that I can better understand your offer.

comments.author: Krislaw
comments.body: Quote from: Stalker22 on March 14, 2023, 08:10:58 PMQuote from: Moto9999 on March 14, 2023, 05:15:11 PMAm selling my btc account containing 0.3 btc for ethereum if it is a reputable member I go first Unless you can withdraw funds to another wallet address (non custodial), it is probably a scam.Please provide more details so that I can better understand your offer.Most likely is a scam.I am sure he going to ask you to register for an account on a platform and send you the BTC, thinking you'd send on-chain ETH to his/her wallet address. It's better to avoid a transaction like this with OP judging by the post history the account.

comments.author: Cryptoababe
comments.body: Bitcoin is Bitcoin. You cant sell account. Bitcoin is a decentralised asset which the account cant be sold. So, seems you are just trying to go around to get someone hooked to a frozen exchange account or so.

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: Quote from: stompix on March 14, 2023, 06:13:20 PM>>snip<<My bad. I have no spendable merits Â  Quote from: Moto9999 on March 14, 2023, 05:15:11 PMAm selling my btc account containing 0.3 btc for ethereum if it is a reputable member I go first Well you can get first then, send the 0.3 BTC to this address: 1LnH6CRGtyxPKE9vd5HZfRNQSmhZ3YKjNqMy rate will be 5% for the troubles.

comments.author: coin-investor
comments.body: Quote from: Krislaw on March 14, 2023, 09:17:01 PMQuote from: Stalker22 on March 14, 2023, 08:10:58 PMQuote from: Moto9999 on March 14, 2023, 05:15:11 PMAm selling my btc account containing 0.3 btc for ethereum if it is a reputable member I go first Unless you can withdraw funds to another wallet address (non custodial), it is probably a scam.Please provide more details so that I can better understand your offer.Most likely is a scam.I am sure he going to ask you to register for an account on a platform and send you the BTC, thinking you'd send on-chain ETH to his/her wallet address. It's better to avoid a transaction like this with OP judging by the post history the account.It should be on a wallet-to-wallet basis, not sending his BTC from a questionable exchange and then you will send Ethereum on the chain, that's ridiculous, you are an idiot to fall into this scheme based on his post history this guy is trying to scam people who will fall to this trap not knowing that we know this kind of scheme, imagine asking for a loan in exchange for collateral that's in a questionable and new exchange.We should tag this account so people will know his scheme.
